At first I was skeptical about buying it because too me it seemed like a game that does the same thing over and over again. I was wrong though each area is different in some way and it's fun. There are some nice puzzles in which you have to figure out what to do which are super fun and so far I didn't run into any I found extremely difficult. The combat is fun which I was suprised about.  I thought because you couldn't zoom in with weapons that it would be a boring experince but not at all.  Also the story was amazing. One of my favorite storylines compared to others. Trust me this game isn't a one trick pony. I really recommend this game one of my favorites. Rank: 100/100

I played through Half-Life 2 and it's episodes for the first time in the summer of last year (2019). I'd seen it, and I'd heard a lot of good things about it so I was like: "Yeah, I'll get it, why not." And I was blown away as soon as I started the game. I'd played Garry's Mod prior to playing Half-Life 2, and it has Half-Life 2's npcs in the base game, so I knew who the "bad guys" were and the enemy types. Now, I'll get into the actual review.

I loved the story and setting of Half-Life 2, it was a refreshing take on science-fiction and stood out from other sci-fi games. The Valve team did an awesome job on the design and personalities of the characters in the game, making them feel believable and real. They also use environmental storytelling to let the player explore the story themselves. When I first played the game, it felt refreshing discovering things for myself and seeing how much the world had changed after the Seven Hour War. This method of storytelling (in my opinion) is much better than having an exposition dump or long cutscenes.

I didn't realize Half-Life 2 was released in 2004 until I looked at the store page. The graphics are still better than some games released in the late 2000's and early 2010's. The Source Engine's graphics capabilities are outstanding for their time, and I found areas like White Forest amazing.

The combat in Half-Life 2 was pretty standard but it's also mobile, and you can turn most objects into weapons once you get the Gravity Gun. You can move around and outflank your opponents and find more ways to beat them than just shooting them. Enemy placement is another thing that made the game's combat better. In Route Kanal, the game places the metrocops near the explosive barrels barrels, and makes it obvious that they can be used against your enemy. There are many more examples of this outside of Route Kanal, too.

The game's system of teaching the player about it's mechanics is also different. Going back to the Route Kanal example, the game places explosive barrels. First, the game shows you what the barrels are, then you go through a room where you have to confront the barrels to continue, as you'd have to go out of your way to move the barrels, which is much harder than shooting them to make them explode so you can continue. Next, it gives you an opportunity to use the barrels against your enemies. To put it simply, the game shows you something, and then expands on it so you know how to use different mechanics. Again, this is just one example, and there are many more.

Overall I'd give Half-Life 2 an eleven out of ten. Amazing game. Valve has created a masterpiece.
тут людям запретили трахаться

The best single-player FPS I have ever played hands down. I just recently played this game with no expectations or nostalgia, and It blew me away. Considering this game was released in 2004, this is a feat in gaming, to have a game that is not only still fun, but feels like it could have been made today with the same effect.

If you haven't played it yet, you are missing out on a masterpiece. If you have played and wondering whether or not you should give it another go, do it, and if you haven't already, check out the Mmod, it is basically an enhanced vanilla mod for the game. 

Even though I played this game for my first time this year, about 16 years after its release, it is easily one of my favorite games of all time. Better than any of its type that I've played.
